bug.author: lcerman
bug.summary: number_input widget renders extra spinner next to the text field in Firefox
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
When using st.number_input('test', 0, 10) there is extra up-down spinner (see the attached screenshot) between the text field and the -+ section. Both -- the spinner and the -+ area -- are active, i.e., properly decrement/increment the number. This only happens in Firefox, in Chrome there is no spinner. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Insert the st.number_input('test', 0, 10) in the py source. Run the streamlit. Navigate to the streamlit page in Firefox.
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Only -+ section appears. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
An extra up-down spinner rendered, which looks weird. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no idea... didn't test... <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.49.0 Python version: 3.6.8 python -m venv venv OS version: Ubuntu 18.04 inside WSL under Windows 10 Browser version: 70.0.1 (64-bit)
